data.title: RigidBody2D ignores set_position when switching between MODE_RIGID and MODE_STATIC/KINEMATIC
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**

Windows 10, current master branch (6d233c651b21ecaef78fbb20d0365a22919b72b1), nVidia GeForce GTX 1080, driver version V385.41  (but probably not related to GPU)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

When switching a RigidBody2D to `MODE_STATIC` or `MODE_KINEMATIC`, changing its position, and then switching back to `MODE_RIGID` and applying an impulse, movement starts at the position where the previous movement stopped, not at the current position.

**Steps to reproduce:**

In the example project, move the ball to the green area and click LMB to launch the ball. Move to the red area and click the button again to attach the ball to the mouse. When moving the mouse the ball sticks to the mouse position as expected. Click the mouse button over the red area; the ball will launch in the green area, not from its current position.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

[2D-Physics.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1274695/2D-Physics.zip)

data.title: Controller not found with udev
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Debian Linux Testing ("Buster")
Godot v3.0.alpha.custom_build.3873362
Wired Xbox 360 controller

**Issue description:**
When Godot is compiled with udev, my controllers input is lost.
Without udev, it works as expected.
This issue is found in both the editor-run-mode and the projects exported binary.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Compile Godot and/or exporter template with the `udev=yes` flag.
Create project with input_mapping bound to xbox 360 controller.
Run said project and notice how nothing happens when axises are used. (I haven't tried buttons)

data.title: [Godot 2.1.4] can't scale the font size in the built-In script editor.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
macOS 10.12.6, Godot 2.1.4 stable

**Issue description:**
In Godot 2.1.4 beta and the previous versions, you can press <kbd>Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>=</kbd> and <kbd>Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>-</kbd> to scale up and down the font size. However, in Godot 2.1.4 stable, this functionality is gone.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open up the built-in script editor on Godot 2.1.4 on macOS. Press <kbd>Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>=</kbd>.

data.title: "Condition ' p_axis.is_normalized() == false ' is true."
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Debian Testing ("Buster")
Godot v3.0.alpha.custom_build.3873362
Asus Radeon R9 290X, amdgpu driver (Not graphics related issue though..)

**Issue description:**
I get about 3-4 thousand lines per second stating that the
`Condition ' p_axis.is_normalized() == false ' is true.`
cluttering my error log. Also, about every 10th line, the message
`Condition ' determinant() == 0 ' is true.`
pops up. Also, a little more sparsely,
`Condition ' det == 0 ' is true.`
is given. No idea why.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create new 3D project. Import two COLLADA files.
Create VehicleBody and VehicleWheels for first of said imported files.
Try to run the game through the "play" button in the top right corner.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[second_godot.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1274268/second_godot.zip)

Emit Timeout = 1

When the particles2d stop emitting and all the particles becomes invisible, I want the free the particles2d node. But I can not find an easy way to do this, since no Notification or signal is emitted for this event, I can not  determine when the particles2d node is ready for free.

Is it possible to add a Notification when the particles2d is not emitting and no particles in the node?

data.title: Deployed app cannot see base class
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):
Windows 7 Professional , 64bit .
GeForce GTX 750ti
Godot 2.1.4
 64 bit (Windows)

**Issue description:**
When I deploy my game to Windows EXE,  I get the following:
SCRIPT ERROR: GDScript::load_byte_code: Parse Error: Invalid 'extends' syntax, expected string constant (path) and/or Identifier (parent class).
           At: res://data/game.gdc:2
ERROR: GDScript::load_byte_code: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_PARSE_ERROR
   At: modules\gdscript\gd_script.cpp:720

**Steps to reproduce:**
It seems to just happen with a class which extends a gd script. In the attached sample  I have a **base.gd** file with a ready function, and a **comp.gd** file which extends it.   Both my game and the attached test project run fine in the editor, just not when deployed for windows.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1273415/bug.zip)

data.title: [Godot 2.1.4] Custom node types can't add a script via the Add A Script button.
data.body:
Specifically in Godot 2.1.4, when you add a custom node type to the node hierarchy, it will have it's script already attached. If you then remove that script by clicking on the trash can icon, you would expect the trash can to change to the Add A Script button, but it doesn't. Consequently, you can only add a script to a custom node type by directly editing the attached script value in the Inspector.

![2017-09-03 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30008543-3af7b6f2-90e6-11e7-9805-72f5828b36d4.png)

![2017-09-03 4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30008545-3ebb5956-90e6-11e7-8c26-1d5a4d7ae942.png)

![2017-09-03 5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30008546-425bfcb4-90e6-11e7-9dba-cbd11594407e.png)

data.title: Custom node types are created with their script attached to them
data.body:
Godot 2.1.4 and Godot 3.0 both make it so that custom node types, when added to the node hierarchy, have their internal script attached to them when they SHOULD have NO script attached by default, just like any other node.

Godot 2.1.4:
![2017-09-03 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30008484-c986fa32-90e5-11e7-880c-7b1b1cd97c4c.png)
![2017-09-03 4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30008486-cf83b8d0-90e5-11e7-9acd-e3d9f6548ff1.png)

data.title: Added controllable mask for auto raycast in 3D camera.
data.body: The 3D camera has an automatic raytrace selection mechanism built-in, but doesn't have a way to control its mask or disable it entirely. This simply adds a control for setting this.

data.title: Macros in GDScript
data.body:
The question of course debatable, but what about macros?

```
# Without macros
extends Node

onready var node = $'Label'

func _ready():
	node.text = "Value \"%s\" from macros" % 12
```


```
# With macros
macros
extends Node

@ovar = onready var
@BAD_TEXT (val):
	return ("Value \"%s\" from macros" % val)

ovar node = $'Label'

func _ready():
	node.text = BAD_TEXT(12)
```

This option is very primitive and not very comfortable, but it is one of variants of my vision macros.
It is clear that language and so is very convenient, but to solve routine parts of the code sometimes is very convenient.
So it seems to me that the parser can handle macros even while writing the script itself (as a function or vars ).
Sometimes there are things that cannot be replaced by functions or other designs.

P.S.: Sorry if you strongly disagree with my thoughts. This is just a suggestion.

data.title: AnimationPlayer will ignore overriding set_pos() in script when animating
data.body:
**Issue description:**
While animating a Node2D using AnimationPlayer it will ignore any set_pos(), set_rot() and set_scale() in script and will always use the base function. 
I'm mainly overriding set_pos() in order to detect any movement which works as intended except when moving an object via AnimationPlayer. Doing some snooping in the source code shows that the AnimationPlayer only calls the base function.
I'm using 2.1.4 stable but this should be relevant for 3.0 as well.
If this was intended for performance reason then a signal or a way to detect changed properties will be appreciated.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Have a Node2D with a script that overrides set_pos(), then use AnimationPlayer node to move it, it will move correctly but without using the script function.

data.title: External script editing does not trigger reload of running game
data.body:
**Windows 10 Godot 3.0 v3.0.alpha.custom_build.af97525**

**Issue description:**
Editing script file in external file editor with `Sync Script Changes` does not trigger reload

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Create a scene and attach a new script file which prints something every second
* Enable `Sync Script Changes`
* Change message from normal editor - Godot reloads
* Open external editor (for example VSCode) and edit it.
* The file reloads in the Godot file editor if opened, but doesn't reload the project

data.title: [Discussion] Preview for scenes
data.body:
Do you think it would make sense to have some kind of preview for tscn files without having to open the scene?

e.g. I have a project with many different trees. Every tree has its own scene. When I'm looking for a specific tree I have to open every scene until I find the one I'm looking for and then close every other scene I have opened this way. 

I thought of two possible solutions: 

1. The preview could show inside the inspector.

2. Or maybe it could open the scene as a temporary tab, like in Atom or visual studio code when single-clicking on a text file from the folder-tree. And when you select another scene, the temporary tab closes automatically. When you change something inside the scene, the temporary tab turns into a normal scene tab.

What do you think?

data.title: 2DEditor: enhance viewport cursor shape
data.body:
Show two-head arrows when resizing Node2D, hand cursor when moving, etc.

I'm not sure but it seems like the conditionals could be simplified.

data.title: Inspector behavior when opening scripts
data.body:
When opening a script, not only is it opened in the script editor but also in the Inspector.
I understand that this is the desired behavior when clicking on the edit option of the Script property in the Inspector.
However, it's very annoying when opening scripts just for source edition, be it an external editor or the built-in editor.

This is more noticeable when changing exported properties or its values, you have to click the _"Go to previous ..."_ arrow in the inspector in order to see the changes.

data.title: Fixes language overridden external editors
ScrollContainer problem with dynamic content
data.body:
Hello,

I'm on windows 10 64bits, with godot 2.1.4.

I have a VBoxContainer inside a ScrollContainer. I add and remove items to the VBox dynamically though code. When I do this, the scrollbar gets messed up. Either it too large for the content or it shows up when it shouldn't.
As soon as you try to move the scrollbar it automatically fixes it self. To see the bug just open the attached project, run it, and click the button a few times. You will quickly see how the scrollbar is wrong, especially if you try to move it and see it disappear or resize.

[ScrollTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1273116/ScrollTest.zip)

data.title: Another tooltip problem on PopupMenu
data.body:
Hello,

I'm on Windows 10 64bits, using godot 2.1.4
[MenuButton.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1273106/MenuButton.zip)

Unlike issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10930, this time I put an sequential id so both tooltips work. However after you hover the mouse over Option 1 and see the tooltip, if you immediately move over to Option 2 you will not see that tooltip. You have to move the moused around a bit and then come back to Option 2 to see the tooltip. Tooltips should show regardless of any other tooltips shown previously.

data.title: Tooltip problem on PopupMenu
data.body:
Hello,

I'm on Windows 10 64bits, using godot 2.1.4
[MenuButton.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1273068/MenuButton.zip)


I add a menu button to an empty scene. I have the following code:

```
extends MenuButton

func _ready():
	var pop = get_popup()
	pop.add_item("Option 1", 0)
	pop.set_item_tooltip(0, "Tooltip 1")
	pop.add_item("Option 2", 10)
	pop.set_item_tooltip(10, "Tooltip 2")
```

But the tooltip for item with id 10 (Option 2) doesn't show. However if I give ID 1, it shows. I seams to be expecting a sequential id starting from zero instead of an arbitrary id. 

But if there is an option to pass an ID, then it should work with the id provided.
